profileText: A Representative from Virginia; born at ``Mount Pleasant,'' near Loretto, Essex County, Va., April 26, 1789; attended the College of New Jersey (now Princeton University); studied law; was admitted to the bar and commenced practice in Lloyds, Va.; member of the State house of delegates in 1816 and 1817; elected as a Republican to the Fifteenth, Sixteenth, and Seventeenth Congresses, reelected as a Crawford Republican to the Eighteenth Congress, and elected as a Jacksonian candidate to the Nineteenth Congress (March 4, 1817-March 3, 1827); was not a candidate for renomination in 1826; resumed the practice of law in Lloyds; died on his estate, ``Champlain,'' near Lloyds, Essex County, Va., August 15, 1840; interment in the family burying ground on his estate.

researchRecord.name: 1824, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Robert S. Garnett to John Quincy Adams written on February 7, 1824. In the letter, Garnett sends two copies of Col. Taylor's "New views of the Constitution" to Mr. Adams with the request that Adams will keep one and give the other to his father.

researchRecord.name: 1824, 1 item.
researchRecord.description: A letter from James Mercer Garnett to his brother, Robert Selden Garnett written on May 15, 1824. In the letter, James Garnett asks his brother to forward a letter, cancels a previous book purchase request, and inquires into the expense of having a pamphlet printed.

researchRecord.name: In the Thomas Jefferson Papers, 1785-1822, 8 items.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Robert Selden Garnett.

researchRecord.name: 1819-1833, 10 items.
researchRecord.description: The papers of Robert Selden Garrett include his correspondence (while in Loretto, Essex County, Va., and Washington, D.C.) with John Quincy Adams (concerning Richard Bland Lee), James Mercer Garnett (of "Elmwood," Essex County, Va.), James Saul, and Smith Thompson (concerning John Marshall and John Ruffin); letter written by James Mercer Garnett to Gales & Seaton of Baltimore, Md.; and the seal of James Mercer Garnett.

researchRecord.name: 1833, 36 pages.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Henry Lee to William Berkeley Lewis written on July 26, 1833. Subjects covered in the letter include Robert Selden Garnett.

researchRecord.name: 1824, 1 page.
researchRecord.description: A letter from Henry Lee to Robert Selden Garrett written on January 1, 1824. In the letter, Lee writes concerning a request that Robert Selden Garnett ask President James Monroe for permission to quote one of Monroe's letters to his father, Henry Lee, in a forthcoming book. This letter is a photocopy; the original letter is in the Alexander William Armour Collection, Princeton, N.J.

researchRecord.name: In the William Garnett Chisolm Papers, 1749-1955, approximately 1,784 items.
researchRecord.description: Other authors include Robert Selden Garnett.

researchRecord.name: In the Preston Family Papers, 1773-1862, 249 items.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Robert Selden Garnett.

researchRecord.name: In the Tayloe Family Papers, 1650-1970, 6 items.
researchRecord.description: Persons represented include Robert Selden Garnett.

researchRecord.name: In the Ware Family Papers, 1748-1981, 134 items.
